page.title: 14ST.JAMES'CHURCH,CRADLEY
page.content: As you approach the sandstone church you will see a tree lined track leading up to the lych gate which is made completely out of wood.On your right will be a yew tree which incidentally is about 350 years old.If you go down the track you will see the clock tower.The bottom half of the tower is 800 years old and the belfry is 600 years old.If you turn right you come to a porch and then through a 12th century doorway into the nave.In the North aisle is a lady chapel and a great organ.The Church held a flower festival in June but it may become an annual event.Various parts of the church were beautifully decorated by local organisations,the Scouts, the school,the W.I. etc..Lots of visitors came to the church during the flower festival and some came from the other side of the world.
